item.title: iam8bit sues Skybound Games for $4m, claiming breach of contract and theft of designs
item.content:encoded:
iam8bit also alleges Skybound used the former's trade secrets to cut it out of a Stray deal.

Iam8bit is suing Skybound Games for £2.9 million ($4 million), alleging breach of contract, fraudulent expenses, theft of designs, and claiming that Skybound used iam8bit's trade secrets to cut it out of a Stray deal.

Iam8bit – which entered into a partnership with Robert Kirkman's game studio, Skybound, in 2021 – alleges Skybound failed to provide its contractually obligated monthly reports, and "padded its expenses with millions of dollars in fake line items".

After Skybound was reportedly unable to provide evidence of the line items to a third-party auditor, 8bit has now filed a breach-of-contract complaint with the Los Angeles Superior Court.

In the complaint seen by Engadget, iam8bit similarly claims that after designing promotional materials for the launch of Stray, Skybound used iam8bit's materials to secure its own deal for the Nintendo Switch port, intentionally cutting the latter out while using "almost exact copies" of 8bit's marketing materials.

Iam8bit also claims Skybound used confidential information about 8bit's royalty split with Annapurna Interactive to cut it out of the deal.

In all, iam8bit is suing for breach of contract, fraud, conversion, unjust enrichment, and misappropriation. It's seeking real and punitive damages totalling $4 million. Neither company has publicly commented on the lawsuit.

item.title: There's a "big" Star Wars game announcement on the way, and the title "ends with The Old Republic", teases leaker
item.content:encoded:
A noted leaker claims there's a "big" Star Wars announcement on the way, hinting the game's title ends "The Old Republic".

Kurakasis, a video game researcher and notable leaker who has correctly leaked announcements ahead of time before, first teased the news last week, stressing that the "big Star Wars game" has "nothing to do with Star Wars: Zero Company or Eclipse", two Star Wars-flavoured games already announced.

Then, over the weekend, the leaker turned it up a notch and alleged the title of the game "ends with The Old Republic", appending a wide-eyed emoji.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As many are speculating on in the comments on X/Twitter, thoughts immediately turn to Saber Interactive's long-in-the-works and reportedly troubled Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake. In March, the team broke its silence to assure us that it was still on the way, telling us, "Everything that we have talked about is still in development", but it's been pretty quiet ever since.

Interestingly, though, the leaker clearly uses the word "announcement", intimating it's either huge news about an existing game... or a revelation about one we don't yet know about.

That's possibly why some fans hope it will be a single-player Old Republic game. But without any formal word from Lucasfilm Games, it's probably best not to get your hopes up just yet. With The Game Awards just days away, though, we may finally get to see more later this week. Watch this space.

Admittedly, there hasn't been much information about any of the Star Wars games currently in development lately, either, but in October, Quantic Dream assured us that it was still developing Star Wars: Eclipse, the game first revealed in 2021. In October 2023, development was said to be "simmering", while earlier this year, Quantic Dream CEO Guillaume de Fondaumière confirmed the studio was not impacted by cuts at NetEase and development continued "at full pace".

Go just a little further back, and EA finally gave us our first look at its upcoming Star Wars strategy game, Star Wars: Zero Company back in April. The single-player turn-based tactics game by Bit Reactor and Respawn was confirmed back in 2022, described as a "gritty and authentic original story set in the twilight of the Clone Wars".
